results.title: The Hidden half = Nimeh-ye penhan [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Tahmineh Milani, Mohammad Nikbin, Iranian Film Society and Arta Film
results.brief_description: The dutiful wife of an Iranian judge uses her husband’s impending case of a woman facing execution for an unspecified crime to reveal the truth of her past revolutionary activities and to illustrate that the stories of people must be heard before passing judgement. Using the device of a diary and an extended flashback, Fereshteh (Niki Karima, Best Actress, Cairo International Film Festival) explains how her life changed drastically when she went to university, joined the Communist party, then fell in love with a married man. Feminist director Tahmineh Milani was imprisoned by the Islamic Revolutionary Court following the film’s release and is on parole; the film was also pulled from Tehran screens after a month but later returned. Melodramatic at times, the film’s history overshadows its content yet still manages to convey the oppression of Iranian women under an Islamic regime in pre and post revolutionary Iran. In Farsi with English subtitles. Please note: the white subtitles are sometimes hard to read on screen.

results.title: The Haunted house of horror
results.creator_credit: Michael Armstrong, Tony Tenser and Tigon
results.brief_description: A game in an old haunted house is suddenly shattered by uncontrollable violence. As merriment turns to vulnerability, the party-goers try and halt the roller-coaster descent towards madness and the tragic, terrifying climax. Only those with nerves strong enough to witness the psychotic happenings in this House of Horrors, will know what lies waiting in the dark.

results.title: The Hasans: a Buginese trading family
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
The Bugis were once the feared pirates of the Java Sea. Today they run trading junks (Prahu) between the islands of Indonesia. This film is about the Hasan family, who runs a fleet of boats from the West Java port of Surabaya. Pak Hasan operate the trading ships on the Java sea. Their history and that of their business shows the strength, stamina and skill contributed by the sons, and the guidance and experience on their father.

results.title: Azhari Ali: an Acehnese university student
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Keith Gow, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
Set in the city of Banda Acec, this film traces the daily life of Azhari Ali, a student of agriculture at the University of Syiah Kuala. He is a devout Moslem. His lodgings and some money were provided by the Mosque authorities. This money provides his travel to the University, some extra money is gained by teaching the Koran five nights a week. Only late at night can this ambitious 25 year-old find time to study away from his daily commitments.

results.title: Angklung orchestra
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, John Morris and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
An Angklung is a Javanese bamboo instrument which is rattled to produce a fixed note. Originally tuned to the pentatonic scale it was used in traditional music. However, today it is usually tuned to the diatonic scale and Western-style music is performed. In this film the Bandung Conservatorium Orchestra demonstrates the complexity of the instrument and plays a well-known waltz.

results.title: The Hidden Fortress = Kakushi toride no san akunin [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Akira Kurosawa, Masumi Fujimoto and Toho Kabushiki Kaisha
results.brief_description: The story of rival clans, hidden gold and a princess in distress becomes, in Kurosawa’s masterful hands, a thrilling mixture of fairy-tale and Samurai movie, with the finest elements of a John Ford Western and a Shakespearean drama thrown in for good measure. Toshiro Mifune excels in a role which he subsequently made his own - the unmatched warrior - and his skill as horseman and swordsman is matched only by Kurosawa’s skill behind the camera and in the editing suite. Misa Uehara as the princess in exile is a potent mix of strength and vulnerability, and the choreographed set pieces set cinematic precedents which are hard to follow. Also available on VHS [308157].

results.title: Balinese gong orchestra
results.creator_credit: John Morris, Keith Gow and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
A simple explanatory film on the well-known Indonesian Gamelan Gong, using the Tunjuk Orchestra. Each instrument is explained and demonstrated, then the orchestra plays a piece from the Ramayana Ballet Suite. This was “written” in the 1950’s and is based on traditional tunes. An excellent introduction to this music, quite strange and exciting to Western ears.

results.title: Taram: a Minangkabau Village
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, John Morris, Brian Hannant and Keith Gow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Our Asian neighbours: Indonesia”.
In the Indonesian village of Taram, Sumatra, the clan inheritance is passed from mother to daughter - a matrilineal society. The husband is considered a guest in his wife’s house. This film centres around a man of high rank in the village. It shows the daily occupations of the villagers, and a ceremony in which the hereditary clan leaders are raised
